scenarioDescription:
The TCP J05074264+2447555 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TCP J05074264+2447555 is a star with 0.25 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 2204.41 light years away from the solar system.

TCP J05074264+2447555 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TCP J05074264+2447555 system


TCP J05074264+2447555 b

TCP J05074264+2447555 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2018-05, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TCP J05074264+2447555 b is 9.222 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TCP J05074264+2447555 b is 2.990 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TCP J05074264+2447555 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TCP J05074264+2447555, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: TCP J05074264+2447555 - System With 1 Exoplanet
